alert.note: Alert for Western Loudoun (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 10:16AM EST until January 12 at 2:30AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Baltimore MD/Washington DC has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Virginia... Maryland... Potomac River at Point of Rocks affecting Frederick MD and Western Loudoun zones. For the Potomac River...including Paw Paw, Hancock, Dam Number Five, Shepherdstown, Harpers Ferry, Point of Rocks, Edwards Ferry, Little Falls...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Potomac River at Point of Rocks. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, The parking lots at both the McKimmey and Brunswick boat ramps begin to flood. Flooding of an agricultural field adjacent to the McKimmey boat ramp is occurring. About half the lower parking lot of the Point of Rocks boat ramp is also flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 2.5 feet, or 13.5 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Tue Wed Wed Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7PM 1AM 7AM Stg Time Date Potomac River Point of Rocks 16.0 2.5 Tue 9 am 2.7 3.2 4.6 16.5 1pm Thu &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this evening at 630 PM EST.
